Eagle Eyes Scan is a desktop app for Search and Rescue teams to locate missing persons by drone.


Real-time detection for any drone

Use on any drone with a livestream, or scan prerecorded video or images.

Find color and motion anomalies

Identify objects as small as a pixel, unnoticed by the human eye.

Fast and simple

Scan live video or large datasets with minimal training or tuning.


Experience our Automatic Detection System in action

Try all SAR features for 30 days

Catch every detail. Scan for clues in live and pre-recorded videos and images with real-time object detection.







Compare tiers

Free

SAR

+
File sync & organization
Sync recent recordings from your drone's SD card to your laptop seamlessly.
Keep your videos and images organized in case files.
+
Advanced inspection tools
Inspect videos, images, frames, and pixels in detail using advanced frame and zoom controls.
+
Annotation & bookmarks
Annotate files and create a library of bookmarked objects of interest for reference.
+
Livestream support
Connect your drone’s controller to record and analyze live streams effortlessly (HDMI capture card required).
Pause live streams at any time and go back in time to revisit footage.
Monitor live folders for new images as they are captured.
+
Automatic Detection-System
Scan live or pre-recorded footage on color and motion anomalies without delays.
Sort detections by the rarity of their color, or how well they match a chosen color.
+
PDF Reports
Export bookmarks in PDF format with drone coverage, images of objects of interest, and their locations, to send to your team.
+
KML export for SARtopo & Google Earth
Share drone flight paths and objects of interest via KML export.
Import these KML files in your preferred mapping tool to update your team on where the drone has searched and where objects were found.

+ Can I trial the SAR license?
Yes, we offer a 30-day free trial of the SAR license. You can request a trial here.
+ Where can I find a manual or video walkthrough?

5 minute intro to Eagle Eyes Scan

Livestreaming with HDMI

Eagle Eyes Scan Manual

The user manual can be viewed here.

+ Does Eagle Eyes Scan run on Mac?
Eagle Eyes Scan runs on both Windows and MacOS/OSX. For Apple devices, we strongly recommend installing on a device with ARM64 architecture (M1, M2, M3, or M4 chipsets). We do offer a distribution for Intel-based (x86) Apple computers, but performance may vary.
+ Does the software work offline?
Yes. The application works completely offline. The only thing you need the internet for is to get a license key to unlock the software on your device once.
+ Can I share my license with others?
We currently only offer machine-locked licenses, meaning that a license is specific to the device you run the software on. You are free to share your device with other users within your organization. In order to accommodate multiple devices, we offer team licences that contain multiple keys. A key unlocks the license on a single device. Once issued, keys cannot be revoked or transferred to another device.
+ Do my recordings remain on my computer?
Yes - we take data-privacy seriously, and Eagle Eyes Scan will never upload your recordings to the internet.
+ Is thermal footage supported?
Currently, the detector does not run on Thermal. It is something we are working on adding. However, you can still look at and annotate thermal imagery with Eagle Eyes. When you load a video, you can load the thermal recording alongside it. Eagle Eyes will take care of aligning the two in time. For images - Eagle Eyes looks for common patterns (like DJI_0123_W.JPG, DJI_0123_T.JPG) and tries to match them up by name. You can press “T” to switch between visual and thermal.
